children.text: The tiling has been incorrectly cut around the penetration, leaving a visible gap around the tiles, which looks poorly finished, and will allow water to leak in behind the tiles.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3958.1 Guide to the Installation of Ceramic Tiles requires in section 5.4.3 Fitting, that

‘The cutting and fitting of tiles and accessories should be carried out as follows: (a) Cut edges smooth and install the tile without jagged or flaked edges; (b) Fit the tile closely where the edges will be covered by trim, escutcheons or other similar devices’.

The poorly installed or damaged tiles should be re-cut to properly fit around this area, rather than a zinc cover plate fitted. The problem with zinc cover plates is that the tapware will take many years to start showing signs of rust, whereas the cover plate will almost immediately start to show signs of surface rust, which will detract from the overall finish in this area.
